Identification.LongTitle: Certain Fees in Respect of the Issuance of Identity and Travel Documents (Haiti) Remission Order

Provision.Text: Her Excellency the Governor General in Council, considering that it is in the public interest to do so, on the recommendation of the Treasury Board, the Minister of Citizenship and Immigration and the Minister of Foreign Affairs, makes the annexed Certain Fees in Respect of the Issuance of Identity and Travel Documents (Haiti) Remission Order under subsection 23(2.1)a of the Financial Administration Actb.

Section.Text: In this Order, document means any of the following:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a passport, as defined in section 2 of the Canadian Passport Order;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a certificate of citizenship, as defined in subsection 2(1) of the Citizenship Act;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a travel document issued to a permanent resident under subsection 31(3) of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act;

Section.Text: Remission is granted to any person who meets the conditions set out in section 3 of the fees paid or payable set out in any of the following provisions, in respect of a document or the provision of services:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: paragraph 7(c) and items 9, 10 and 14 of the schedule to the Passport and Other Travel Document Services Fees Regulations;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: item 6 of the schedule to the Citizenship Regulations;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: section 4 of the Consular Services Fees Regulations;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: section 315 of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Regulations;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: subsections 296(1), 298(1) and 315.1(1) of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Regulations.

Subsection.Text: Remission of the fees referred to in paragraphs 2(a) to (d) is granted on condition that

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: at some time during the period beginning on March 1, 2024 and ending on September 1, 2024, the person, as a Canadian citizen or permanent resident of Canada, was in Haiti and was required to travel on an urgent basis as a result of the deteriorating security situation in Haiti; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: during the period referred to in (a), the person, or a person acting on their behalf, submitted an application in respect of a document.

Subsection.Text: Remission of the fees referred to in paragraph 2(e) is granted on condition that the application for a document or provision of services was submitted to the Minister of Citizenship and Immigration by a foreign national who is the family member of a Canadian citizen or permanent resident, and who left Haiti on or after March 1, 2024 and arrived in Canada on or before April 26, 2024.
